Master Answer:
The routine immunization schedule is intended for residents of BC and is publicly funded (free). Read the list of individuals eligible for the hepatitis B vaccine here. For adults, the hepatitis B vaccine is typically given at 0, 1, 6 months. Immunization appointments can be booked at a local health unit; find a location near you here.
If you are not a resident of BC, vaccines may be available for purchase from some doctors' offices, pharmacies (for those 5 years of age and older) and travel health clinics.  Services vary across BC. Bring your vaccine records to any immunization appointment.
Immunization Nurse
